#HalaMadrid

The Real Madrid board of directors, which met today, Monday 11 March 2019, has decided to terminate Santiago Solari's contract as first-team coach, whilst Real Madrid have offered him the opportunity to remain at the club.

Real Madrid wish to thank Solari for his work, commitment and the loyalty that he has always displayed towards this club, which is his home.

The board of directors also agreed on the appointment of Zinedine Zidane as head coach of Real Madrid with immediate effect for the remainder of the season and the next three campaigns, until 30 June 2022.

The Real Madrid president will address the media alongside Zinedine Zidane at 8pm (CET) tonight in the Santiago Bernabéu media room.

Benzema: Lyon confirm talks but "couldn't afford" his wages

Jean-Michel Aulas confirmed the Ligue 1 side had been close to re-signing their former striker but his salary was a bit much for the deal to go through.

Karim Benzema left his hometown club Olympique Lyonnais in 2009 in a 30-million-euro deal to take him to the Bernabéu, where he remains to this day having won four Champions League trophies, two Ligas and two Copas del Rey while becoming the club’s sixth highest-scorer of all time.

Aulas on Benzema: "Financially we couldn't make it happen"

“It would be beautiful of course, to have him back,” Lyon president Jean-Michel Aulas told Tout Le Sport. “We talked about it last summer because he was thinking of leaving, but financially we couldn’t make it work. We tried to come up with something with his agent bit it didn’t happen.”

Zidane called Sergio Ramos after his presentation

New Real Madrid head coach Zinedine Zidane will oversee his first training session back at the club on Wednesday morning, but the Frenchman is already looking to exude his personal touch until the end of the season, just like he would have done if he had taken over in June.

The first thing Zidane did after his second presentation as head coach was call Sergio Ramos and explain to him about all the details of his return and how he wanted everything to move forward from now. Zidane likes that the player wants to participate and values his opinion, but the rules belong to the technical staff.

Zidane's arrival brings Hazard closer to Real Madrid

Chelsea forward Eden Hazard has never hidden the fact that he dreams of one day playing for Real Madrid and the return of Zinedine Zidane as head coach means that the Belgian is now the number one favourite to become the club's Galactico signing in the summer.

Lyon admit that they tried to sign Benzema last summer


This summer will mark Karim Benzema's 10th anniversary at Real Madrid, but Lyon president Jean-Michel Aulas has acknowledged that the striker almost returned to the French side last summer.

"We spoke with him last summer because we raised [the possibility of him coming back to Lyon], but we didn't get to the necessary economic figures," Aulas told Tout Le Sport.

"Of course, it would be very beautiful for him to return to his home."

Gareth Bale's agent speaks to AS about the future under Zidane


Jonathan Barnett gave a clear message about the situation of his Welsh client which was has been the subject of much speculation with recent developments.

Bale to stay if wanted

The representative has categorically stated that there has been no change in the situation of his client despite the return of Zinedine Zidane as manager, announced on Monday. In the final season of the French coach the relationship between him and the forward had not been ideal.

"I would not say that Zidane and I were the best of friends," Bale declared on February 5. That phrase, together with "maybe I'll stay, maybe not..." which the player came out with after the 2018 Champions League final, reflected the potential difficulties in his situation.

After speaking with others close to Bale, the feeling of Barnett is shared. They agree that it is unlikely that he will leave Madrid this summer, something AS already proposed late February. The intention instead is to convince Zidane that he can be a vital part in his new project.

https://en.as.com/en/2019/03/12/football/1552410507_835741.html

Zidane is already at work in Valdebebas


On Tuesday afternoon, Zinedine Zidane arrived at Valdebebas to inspect the facilities of the gymnasium and the pitches for himself.

He was accompanied in getting a first-hand look at his former and new workplace by his assistants David Bettoni and Hamidou Msaidie.

His first training session will take place on Wednesday at 11:00 CET.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/03/12/5c88220cca4741d8698b464c.html

Odegaard on Ajax interest: I don't think I'm worth 20 million euros


Real Madrid's attacking midfielder Martin Odegaard has dismissed the rumours of Ajax being willing to sign him on a 20 million euro fee.

The Norwegian, who is currently on loan at Vitesse, has claimed that his current market value doesn't reach the aforementioned figure.

"I don't think I am worth that much, as the amounts that are moving around in football nowadays are out of control," he said.

"I've read the rumours, but I do not know if they're true."

MARCA recently reported that the Dutch club are eager to acquire the 20-year-old, who has been loaned out to an Eredivisie team for the second year in a row, following his spell at Heerenveen.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/03/12/5c87f630ca47417e108b45fb.html

Zidane to Beckham: I told the Real Madrid players to focus on football


The Real Madrid players were warned by Zinedine Zidane to focus on football during his previous stint at the club, as the Frenchman recently revealed to David Beckham.

"The footballers at Real Madrid have a lot of earning potential," he told Beckham during a sit-down for Adidas.

"I told the players to make the most of the opportunity to play football, instead of thinking about other things.

"Because many think about other things.

"For me, the most important things are those achieved in football with a lot of work and seriousness."

Real Madrid: Zidane's new salary revealed by El Confidencial

According to the newspaper, Zinedine Zidane has been coaxed back to the Real Madrid dugout in exchange for a reasonably affordable salary.

Zidane reportedly on 12m plus add-ons at Real Madrid

According to the newspaper El Confidencial, the Frenchman is to earn a basic annual salary of 12 million euros as part of the three-year deal he was this week handed by club president Florentino Pérez, with that wage then topped up by a series of incentivised add-ons. Such a salary is only half the 24-million-euro yearly pay packet that Diego Simeone now picks up each year at city rivals Atlético Madrid.

Other big-name coaches linked with Madrid would in all likelihood have been significantly more expensive than Zidane. José Mourinho pocketed 20 million euros after tax at Manchester United, while the lower salaries earned by the likes of Mauricio Pochettino (10), Jürgen Klopp (8.5) and Massimiliano Allegri (8) would have been offset by the fact that they are currently in jobs, meaning that Los Blancos would have had to compensate their respective clubs.

quote.msg:
Gareth Bale's agent speaks to AS about the future under Zidane


Jonathan Barnett gave a clear message about the situation of his Welsh client which was has been the subject of much speculation with recent developments.

Bale to stay if wanted

The representative has categorically stated that there has been no change in the situation of his client despite the return of Zinedine Zidane as manager, announced on Monday. In the final season of the French coach the relationship between him and the forward had not been ideal.

"I would not say that Zidane and I were the best of friends," Bale declared on February 5. That phrase, together with "maybe I'll stay, maybe not..." which the player came out with after the 2018 Champions League final, reflected the potential difficulties in his situation.

After speaking with others close to Bale, the feeling of Barnett is shared. They agree that it is unlikely that he will leave Madrid this summer, something AS already proposed late February. The intention instead is to convince Zidane that he can be a vital part in his new project.

Vinicius has posted his first message on social media following the injury he suffered against Ajax last week.
